How many batches will be deleted concurrently
The total number of batches to delete. If 0, delete all batches.

Orders the batches by their creation time (Ascending or Descending); intended to be used with -DeleteLimit
Which status is to be deleted, if not specified, then all are deleted

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Executes a Template by using Document Services.

Executes a Template by using Document Services. This involves creating a batch, attaching a document, configuring a document provider that includes the references to the template and data. Executes this batch, waits for it to complete, and then deletes the batch. Will return error if batch fails. Can return document if -ReturnDocument switch is used.
Name of the BatchGroup where the batch will be created.
Will add a documentOperation to the batch to convert the result to PDF.
Returns the byte array of the generated document
Name of the TemplateGroup where the Template is stored.
Name of the TemplateLibrary where the TemplateGroup exists.
Name of the template to be used.
Actions against the Xpertdoc Portal will timeout in this many seconds.
The XML that will be used as the data source for the document.
Name of the BatchGroup where the batch will be created.
Will add a documentOperation to the batch to convert the result to PDF.
Returns the byte array of the generated document
Name of the TemplateGroup where the Template is stored.
Name of the TemplateLibrary where the TemplateGroup exists.
Name of the template to be used.
Actions against the Xpertdoc Portal will timeout in this many seconds.
The XML that will be used as the data source for the document.

maml:description.maml:para: Measures the throughput of Xpertdoc Portal Document Services for a given template/data.

Measures the throughput of Xpertdoc Portal Document Services for a given template/data. Enables specifying the concurrency, the documents per thread, an array of XML (randomly chosen for each execution).
Name of the BatchGroup where the batches will be created/executed.
Will add a documentOperation to the batches to convert the result to PDF.
The number of batches/documents to be created/executed per concurrent thread.
If set, errored batches will not be deleted.
The number of concurrent threads making requests against the Xpertdoc Portal.
Name of the TemplateGroup where the Template is stored.
Name of the TemplateLibrary where the TemplateGroup exists.
Name of the template to be used.
Actions against the Xpertdoc Portal will timeout in this many seconds.
The XML that will be used as the data source for the document.

Name of the template to be used.
